quoteFirst: The government also protects women from being worked at hours that will necessitate their going home late at night. One labour inspector reported that he found a factory in which a set of girls were put on from
quoteTime: eight to ten in the morning
quoteLast: and then taken off until one. They were worked from one until five, and again from seven to nine, making altogether eight hours. Another lot of girls worked from ten until twelve, from three until seven, and from nine until eleven.
title: Australia, New Zealand and some islands of the South seas
